alert.note: Alert for Shoshone, Lava Beds (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 12 at 11:55AM MST until January 12 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM SATURDAY TO 11 AM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Shoshone, Richfield, and Carey. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 2 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 8 PM this evening to 8 AM MST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 2 PM Saturday to 11 AM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing and drifting snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: For the Blizzard Warning, travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the Winter Storm Warning, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting 511.idaho.gov.
